entries.meaning: A substance that is used to slow the rate of combustion of a solid rocket fuel so as to make it more controllable

verbs.description: delayer (third-person singular simple present delayers, present participle delayering, simple past and past participle delayered)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To remove layers from; to strip away levels from.
examples: I've put on every item of clothing I packed in about eight layers.  […]  Slowly as the morning wore on and I built up a sweat, I de-layered myself. Now I'm down to just two layers of clothing, including two pairs of gloves and socks.
